intro: Tabernaemontana holstii, commonly known as the Holst's star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant, white to pink star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in clusters, often during the rainy season, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in tropical and subtropical gardens.
